NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Cranes, mobile lifting frames and works trucks fitted with a crane
Buckets, shovels, grabs and grips for cranes or excavators
Repair and maintenance services of cranes

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.MA_MAIN_ACTIVITIES: Port-related activities / Maritime or inland waterway
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01F05

TITLE.P: Ship-to-shore and rubber tyre gantry Crane Frameworks

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority is seeking to enter into a Framework Agreements with one or more bidders for the supply of a number of:
1) ship to shore gantry cranes, and,
2) rubber tyre gantry cranes, together with options for the supply of training, support, servicing and purchase of spare parts.

Both within and outside of the warranty period, the Contracting Authority must be able to call upon the successful bidders to provide on-site technical assistance within the next working day following any such request.

The Contracting Authority also wishes to explore its options regarding the automation capability of the cranes, and, for those bidders that are shortlisted for the tender stage of this process, will require a range of options regarding delivery and assembly of the cranes.
The value below, therefore, represents the best estimated total value, taking into account the total number of cranes which may ultimately be purchased and all of the potential options described.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Bidders should note that the Contracting Authority will not award a Framework Agreement for all 3 lots. It is the Contracting Authority's intention to award either:
1) a Framework Agreement to each of the successful bidders for lots 1 and 2 and terminate lot 3, or,
2) a Framework Agreement to the successful bidder for lot 3 only and terminate lots 1 and 2.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 1 relates to the supply of up to 3 electrically powered ship-to-shore gantry cranes, to be used in the unloading and loading of containers to/from ocean-going vessels. There will also be the option for the Contracting Authority to purchase parts, spares packages, support and/or servicing.
Bidders will also be required:
1) to provide a range of options for delivery and assembly of the cranes (both on and off-site), and,
2) to provide a crane that is capable of future adaption for remote control operation.

The options, features available and cost of such operation shall be assessed as part of the tender stage of this procurement. Bidders should also note that the successful bidder for this lot will be required to dismantle and remove the 3 existing ship-to-shore gantry cranes at Belfast Harbour as part of its tender price.

The Contracting Authority may also request the bidder to dismantle other cranes at the Contracting Authority's premises during the term of the Framework Agreement. The value below therefore represents the best-estimated value, taking into account the total number of cranes which may ultimately be purchased and these options.
Further details are provided in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As set out in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Any Framework Agreement entered into by the Contracting Authority will be for an initial 5-year period.

The Contracting Authority shall have the option, acting at its discretion, to extend the Framework Agreement on up to 3 subsequent occasions of 12 months each. Further options regarding the scope of the supplies and services required are specified in the tender and contract documentation.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 2 relates to the supply of up to 9 electrically powered rubber tyre gantry cranes, to be used in the stacking of containers at Belfast Harbour. There will also be the option for the Contracting Authority to purchase parts, spares packages, support and/or servicing.
Bidders will also be required:
1) to provide a range of options for delivery and assembly of the cranes (both on and off-site),
2) to provide a crane that can be remote-controlled with appropriate levels of automated functionality.

The successful bidder for this lot may be requested by the Contracting Authority to dismantle and remove the three existing Transtainer cranes at Belfast Harbour. This will, however, be an option only which the Contracting Authority may exercise at its discretion and shall not form part of the evaluation process.
The value below therefore represents the best-estimated value, taking into account the total number of cranes which may ultimately be purchased and these options.
Further details are provided in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As set out in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Any Framework Agreement entered into by the Contracting Authority will be for an initial 5-year period.

The Contracting Authority shall have the option, acting at its discretion, to extend the Framework Agreement on up to 3 subsequent occasions of 12 months each. Further options regarding the scope of supplies and services required are specified in the tender and contract documentation.

TITLE.P: Ship-to-shore and rubber tyre gantry crane framework

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 3 relates to the supply of both:
1) up to 3 electronically powered ship-to-shore gantry cranes,
2) up to 9 electrically powered rubber tyre gantry cranes, together with the options described in relation to lots 1 and 2 above.
Lot 3 does not, therefore, represent a separate opportunity, but rather is an amalgamation of both lot 1 and lot 2.
The Contracting Authority wishes to explore the efficiencies of a single bidder supplying its requirements under both lots rather than appointing separate bidders to lots 1 and 2.
The Contracting Authority will not, therefore, award a Framework Agreement for all 3 lots. The Contracting Authority will, therefore, award either:
1) a Framework Agreement to each of the successful bidders for lots 1 and 2 and terminate lot 3,
2) a Framework Agreement to the successful bidder for lot 3 only and terminate lots 1 and 2.
The value below represents the best estimated total value, taking into account the total number of cranes which may ultimately be purchased and the options detailed in relation to lots 1 and 2 above.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As set out in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Any Framework Agreement entered into by the Contracting Authority will be for an initial 5-year period.

The Contracting Authority shall have the option, acting at its discretion, to extend the Framework Agreement on up to 3 subsequent occasions of 12 months each. Further options regarding the scope of the supplies and services required are specified in the tender and contract documentation.

SUITABILITY.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: As specified in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire and tender documents.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: As specified in the Pre- Qualification Questionnaire and tender documents.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Information and formalities necessary for evaluating if the requirements are met: As specified in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire and tender documents.

DEPOSIT_GUARANTEE_REQUIRED.P: The Contracting Authority reserves the right to require bonds, deposits, guarantees or other forms of undertaking or security to ensure proper contractual performance.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITION.P: As set out in the tender and contract documentation.

LEGAL_FORM.P: Subject to the status and involvement of the parties, the Contracting Authority may require the parties to commit to joint and several-liabilities in respect of the contract.
Alternatively, the Contracting Authority may require the lead operator to take total responsibility or a consortium to form a legal entity before entering into any contract.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: The performance of the contract is subject to particular conditions: yes.
— The conditions applicable to the contract are set out in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire and tender documents.

INFO_ADD.P: This process is being conducted competitively in accordance with the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (as amended). The procedure to be followed for this procurement is the Negotiated Procedure with a prior call for competition (Regulation 47). Bidders who wish to participate in this procurement are required to provide details of their contact point, together with an email address and telephone number upon downloading the tender documents. Bidders who fail to provide their details to the Contracting Authority or register in this manner will not receive any clarifications or updated information provided by the Contracting Authority during the tender process.

The Contracting Authority is seeking to enter into a Framework Agreements with 1 or more service providers for the supply of a number of rubber tyre gantry cranes (RTG) and ship to shore gantry cranes (STSG), together with the supply of training, support, servicing and the option to purchase spare parts.
This opportunity has been divided into 3 lots:
The Contracting Authority will not award a Framework Agreement for all 3 lots. It is the Contracting Authority's intention, following the conclusion of this tender process, to award either:
1) Framework Agreement to each of the successful bidders for lots 1 and 2 and terminate lot 3, or,
2) a Framework Agreement to the successful bidder for lot 3 only and terminate lots 1 and 2.

The tender documents detail the criterion and process that will be adapted to determine whether the Contracting Authority awards Framework Agreements for lots 1 and 2 or a single Framework Agreement for lot 3.

The costs of responding to this notice and participation in the process (including any and all negotiations) will be borne by each bidder. All discussions and correspondence will be deemed strictly subject to contract until a formal contract is entered into. The formal contract shall not be binding until it has been signed and dated by the duly authorized representatives of both parties.
Bidders satisfying the selection criteria at the pre-qualification stage of this process will be afforded the opportunity of a site visit.
Bidders may also be required, at the invitation to negotiate stage of this process, to demonstrate an operation of a proven crane supply at their or a customer's premises at their own cost.

Further details will be provided by the Contracting Authority in due course. Subject to a sufficient number of satisfactory responses being received, a maximum of the top 3 ranked bidders for each lot will be invited to negotiate following the selection stage of this process, provided that the Contracting Authority, acting at its discretion, reserves the right to invite less than 3 bidders to negotiate.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of Justice in Northern Ireland
ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: Royal Courts of Justice, Chichester Street

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Precise information on deadlines for lodging appeals:
— the Contracting Authority will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to all bidders.
— the standstill period provides time for unsuccessful bidders to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into.

— the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (as amended) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (Northern Ireland).
